###User Defined Function###
_ExcelHorizontalAlignSet

###Description###
Set the horizontal alignment of each cell in a range.

###Syntax###
#Include <Excel.au3>
_ExcelHorizontalAlignSet($oExcel, $sRangeOrRowStart, $iColStart = 1, $iRowEnd = 1, $iColEnd = 1, $sHorizAlign = "left")

###Parameters###
@@ParamTable@@
$oExcel
	An Excel object opened by a preceding call to _ExcelBookOpen() or _ExcelBookNew()
$sRangeOrRowStart
	Either an A1 range, or an integer row number to start from if using R1C1
$iColStart
	The starting column for the number format(left) (default=1)
$iRowEnd
	The ending row for the number format (bottom) (default=1)
$iColEnd
	The ending column for the number format (right) (default=1)
$sHorizAlign
	Horizontal alignment ("left"|"center"|"right") (default="left")
@@End@@

###ReturnValue###
On Success: Returns 1
On Failure: Returns 0 and sets @error on errors:
@error=1: Specified object does not exist
@error=2: Starting row or column invalid
@extended=0: Starting row invalid
@extended=1: Starting column invalid
@error=3: Ending row or column invalid
@extended=0: Ending row invalid
@extended=1: Ending column invalid

###Remarks###
None
